results.title: Battle for bread
results.creator_credit: Richard De Rochemont, United Nations. Film Board and March of Time, Inc.
results.brief_description: The film stresses the importance of food in a world that has never produced enough for everyone, and describes the efforts of FAO to stimulate food production in many countries. After a preliminary survey of the food problem in war-torn countries, the film describes the working of the FAO program; agricultural machinery to China, international conferences on poison sprays for insects, the fight against animal diseases, encouragement to farmers to grow new kinds of crops.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard De Rochemont, United Nations. Film Board and March of Time, Inc.

results.title: Our stake in troubled Morocco
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Describes the political unrest in French Morocco which threatens to endanger strategic American air bases in the area. Traces the causes of the dissatisfaction to an awakening nationalism in the Muslim world and to resentment of the country’s colonial status despite improvements initiated by the French government. Shows the everyday life of the people.

results.title: The American teacher
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Yesterday’s education in the United States was typified by the proverbial Little Red School House and today’s (1947) emphasis is upon the scientific principles of psychology - but all good teachers know that their methods are as individualistic and personal as any other artist’s; all realise the importance of developing in their pupils the ability to think as well as a knowledge of the facts. The film presents the pros and cons of “progressive education” and points out to the American citizen their responsibility for the quality of the education the community provides for its young.

results.title: Progress report on Pakistan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas and Pakistani Ambassador Mohammed Ali discuss the development of Pakistan in the five and a half years of its existence as an independent nation and the strategic importance of the famed Khyber Pass. Surveys the industrial and construction programs for modernizing the country, and presents the problem of Kashmir, an area claimed by both Pakistan and India.

results.title: Men of Medicine
results.brief_description: Follows a young physician through some of the problems facing the young doctor today - successfully meeting the medical needs of his community, and winning the confidence and respect of the people. Discusses how the benefits of modern medicine can be made available to all.

results.title: Radio broadcasting today
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Appraises all types of radio programs such as Jack Benny, Toscanini, sport, news etc. The value of quiz programs and soap operas is questioned and other types of programs are commended. Hooper ratings are explained and Lee DeForest appears briefly in the film to decry the misuse of the medium which he helped develop.

results.title: America's traffic problem
results.brief_description: Presents the national traffic problem created by an automotive age, and shows some of the solutions which have been put into effect to alleviate the situation. Far-sighted educators know that a partial solution to the traffic dilemma is the training of young people in good driving techniques. No other credits available.

results.title: Life with baby
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
How children grow mentally and physically has been studied during the past 35 years by a group of specialists working under the direction of Dr Arnold Gesell at the Yale University Clinic of Child Development. They have been able to establish definite standards of development for children up to six years of age. Many of these findings are illustrated in this film. Non-technical in character, the film aims at a better understanding of the young child by adults and older children.

results.title: Life with grandpa
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
The problems of old age as they affect people in the United States - achievements of medical science in forestalling disease, controlling dangerous ailments earlier in life; with a longer life expectancy, an increasing population of old people; ways of combating prejudices against employing old persons. Some notable personalities of advanced years including Sir Winston Churchill, Dorothy Dix and George Bernard Shaw.

results.title: New ways in farming
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Illustrates modern trends in agriculture such as large-scale factory-style farming, with crops scientifically scheduled and cultivated. Discusses the farm co-operative; and shows how the traditionally independent farmer with the aid of new mechanised farm equipment, is able to make his farm an increasingly prosperous business.
